title: POLiKEY. An information system for polychaete families and higher taxa. Version 2. 05-JUN-03

states: dorsoventrally flattened <body depth much less then body width>
not dorsoventrally flattened <body depth not significantly less than body width>
characters.name: body shape <lateral view>

states: with distinct (but truncate) notopodia and neuropodial tori
with indistinct parapodia, chaetae arise directly from body wall
characters.name: elongate body segments <form of parapodia>

states: present, comprising distinct thorax and abdomen
characters.name: body regionation <presence; number of regions>

states: laterally-directed thoracic parapodia and dorsally-directed abdominal parapodia
major differences in chaetal types over body
major structural differences in parapodia over body <not including first few chaetigers>
characters.name: body regions demarcated by <gross differences in parapodial morphology>

states: more-or-less smooth <may be shiny or dull finish>
thick and rugose <sometimes on anterior body only>
papillate, irregularly arranged papillae <may uniformly spread or restricted to venter and parapodia>
tuberculate, with large and small tubercles arranged in distinct rows
characters.name: epidermis <surface appearance>

states: diffuse whitish patches or stripes <may be difficult to observe>
characters.name: epidermal glands <presence>
cuticularised ventral shield on posterior segments <presence>

states: of relatively unmodified segments (usually bearing reduced parapodia)
characters.name: pre-pygidial region <form>

states: absent, replaced by long articulated tail
simple ring or cone <anus dorsal or terminal>
deeply cleft forming two large feet
characters.name: pygidium <form>

states: one pair of cirri and single medial papilla
characters.name: pygidial appendages <form>

states: discrete and compact, dorsal to mouth
bearing many tentacles (=oral filaments) around mouth
comprising a radiolar crown around mouth
characters.name: head <form>

states: anterior to and distinct from the first segment
level with or posterior to the first segment
characters.name: head <position in relation to first segment>

states: bluntly conical to trapezoidal (narrow end anteriorly)
t-shaped, wide end anteriorly (i.e. resembling lateral horns)
characters.name: prostomium <basic shape>

states: without deep incisions, cirri or palpodes
with four identical small cirriform appendages
characters.name: prostomium anteriorly <form>

states: very large protruding type with spherical lens
characters.name: eyes <form>

states: include paired anterolateral ones and single medial one
characters.name: prostomial antennae <number and position>

states: consist of basal ceratophore and distal ceratostyle
characters.name: prostomial antennae <form>
oral filaments arise <position in relation to mouth>

states: indistinct paired dorsolateral patches <not clearly visible with light microscope>
ciliated bands on either side of median caruncle
characters.name: nuchal organs <form>

states: absent <limited to area around the mouth>
characters.name: peristomial ring <form>

states: without a distinct ventral or axial organ
characters.name: foregut <basic type>

states: with one pair of lateral jaws
with multiple jaw elements of different shapes and sizes
characters.name: foregut <presence and form of jaws>

states: comprising ventral mandibles and dorsal maxillae
comprising many dorsal jaw pieces (micrognaths) arranged in ring and usually pair ventral toothed plates (macrognaths)
characters.name: foregut <form of multiple jaw elements>

states: 4\endash{}5 pairs of toothed plates in parallel rows <i.e. prionognath arrangement>
4\endash{}5 (right) and 4\endash{}6 (left) toothed plates in a semicircle <i.e. labidognath arrangement>
2 pairs of toothed plates plus many small free denticles arranged in longitudinal rows <i.e. ctenognath arrangement>
characters.name: foregut maxillae <form of multiple jaw elements>

states: with teeth (=paragnaths) present in distinct areas
characters.name: foregut <presence and type of tooth-like armature>

states: with transverse ridges of thick cuticular lamellae
with hardened (sclerotised) papillae of different structures <proboscideal organs>
characters.name: foregut surface <form>
foregut superior row <of maxillae; number of free small denticles>

states: present, fused to each other posteriorly
characters.name: foregut superior base plates <of maxillae; presence, fusion with each other>

states: fused with maxillary carrier, not K-shaped
characters.name: foregut superior base plates <fusion of superior base plates and maxillary carrier>

states: shorter than combined length of maxillae
longer than combined length of maxillae
similar in length to combined length of maxillae
characters.name: foregut maxillary carriers <form>

states: with tentacular cirri <usually much shorter than following segments>
characters.name: first segment <appearance>

states: present in at least some cirri
characters.name: tentacular cirri internal aciculae <presence>

states: anteriorly directed and wrapping around head
more-or-less laterally directed and free from head
characters.name: first chaetiger <orientation of parapodia>

states: similar in orientation, length and thickness to other chaetae
projecting obliquely, distinctly thicker and more shiny than subsequent ones (=paleae)
slender and elongate, forming cage around head
characters.name: first chaetiger chaetae <form of chaetae>

states: absent <lobes absent, though chaetae may be present>
biramous <two-branched> with parapodial lobes absent or low
characters.name: parapodia <form, generally>

states: represented by at least one chaetal lobe <not modified>
large, fusiform adorned with sensory hairs
absent <though dorsal cirrus may be present>
characters.name: notopodial lobes <form>

states: represented by at least one chaetal lobe <not modified>
large, fusiform adorned with sensory hairs
low ridges (tori) <may occur only in part of body>
characters.name: neuropodial lobes <form>

states: more-or-less cirriform <may be smooth, wrinkled or annulated>
modified as elytra (may include cirriform ones as well)
characters.name: dorsal cirri <presence; form>

states: smooth or ornamented, without concentric rings
characters.name: elytra <structure>

states: occur on alternate chaetigers throughout the body
occur on alternate chaetigers anteriorly, present on all chaetigers or absent posteriorly
characters.name: elytra <arrangement>

states: occur only on achaetous first segments
occur on at least some chaetigerous segments
occur on posterior end, adjacent pygidium
characters.name: branchiae <distribution>

states: digitiform <may be one or more per parapodium>
characters.name: branchiae <form of parapodial ones>

states: short flattened structures, one pair per chaetiger
filaments arising from a central stalk
characters.name: branchiae <form of dorsal ones>

states: in both dorsal and ventral positions (=noto- and neuroaciculae)
characters.name: aciculae <position>

states: distally tapering <tip may be blunt or sharp>
characters.name: neuroaciculae <form of tip>

states: knife-shaped with pointed or bifid tip
characters.name: capillary chaetae <basic forms>

states: hirsute-serrate <hairs arranged on one or both sides of capillary>
spinose <very short hairs often covering the greater part of the circumference of the chaetae>
corn-eared <spines arranged in whorls completely around chaeta>
characters.name: capillary chaetae <form of edge>

states: tines more or less equal in length
characters.name: forked chaetae <length of tines>

states: present, arranged in fans across dorsum
characters.name: paleae <presence; arrangement>

states: present in most or all chaetigers
present only in one or a few anterior chaetigers
characters.name: spines <presence; distribution>

states: slightly curved and more-or-less smooth <includes sabre-chaetae>
with series of rings or half-rings of spinelets
harpoon or arrow-shaped with reverse barbs
with a single distal or subdistal hair (=aristate or hooded)
characters.name: spines <form>

states: occur in many chaetigers but only one ramus
occur in many chaetigers in both rami (at least posteriorly)
characters.name: hooks <distribution>

states: with teeth in vertical series, teeth usually similar-sized (=pectinate)
with teeth arranged in transverse series above an enlarged main fang (=crested)
with a single tooth surmounting main fang
with multiple teeth arranged in two opposing groups
characters.name: uncini <arrangement of teeth>

states: arranged in one or two rows
arranged in more than two rows
characters.name: uncini <arrangement within each parapodium>

states: with a single hood open in front
with paired guards on each side of the crest
characters.name: compound chaetae appendage <presence of distal covering>

states: more-or-less symmetrical (=homogomph; includes also hemigomph and sesquigomph)
characters.name: compound chaetae joint <symmetry>

states: effected by fold in external sheath of chaeta
characters.name: compound chaetae joint <attachment type>

states: tapering slightly or evenly thick from emergence to joint
characters.name: compound chaetae shaft <form near joint>

states: present in a few anterior chaetigers only
present in most or all chaetigers
characters.name: compound falcigers <distribution>

states: hard, impregnated with calcium carbonate <straight, curved or spiral>
translucent, chitin-like <may be partially covered with sediment particles>
characters.name: tube <presence; type>

states: epizoic <includes free living, parasitic and commensal forms>
characters.name: <habitat; CAUTION: see Notes>

states: three very different body regions, each with highly modified parapodia
strongly elongate median chaetigers with prominent tori near one end of each chaetiger, resembling bamboo
strongly elongate median chaetigers bearing spines which nearly encircle body
epidermis tuberculate, with large and small tubercles arranged in distinct rows
characters.name: diagnostic general body features:

states: single long branchia on dorsal surface of anterior chaetiger
four or more pairs of filiform retractable branchiae on anterior segments
tufted parapodial branchiae in middle of body
interramal branchiae attached to ventral side of notopodia
characters.name: diagnostic branchial features:

states: prostomium bearing very large, camera-type eyes
operculum present, formed from first chaetigers
head bearing paleae and a membraneous cephalic veil
large caruncle behind head bearing ciliated bands
characters.name: diagnostic head features:

states: multiple feeding palps located on dorsal fold within buccal cavity
2 to 3 pairs of foliaceous tentacular cirri
4 (rarely 3) pairs of tentacular cirri arising from a single enlarged segment behind head
4-8 pairs of tentacular cirri arising on first 3-5 segments
characters.name: diagnostic head appendage features:

states: anterior digestive tract forms a strong muscular pump
characters.name: diagnostic pharynx and foregut features:

states: one pair of jaws crossed like a pair of scissors
four massive jaws each with an aileron arranged in a cross
multiple jaw pieces including macrognaths and micrognaths
five pairs of maxillae in a labidognath arrangement
superior base plate and maxillary carriers (of ctenognath jaws) not fused
characters.name: diagnostic pharyngeal jaw features:

states: large, fusiform noto- and neuropodial lobes adorned with sensory hairs
slender flask-shaped notopodial lobes, each with an acicula
slender, flask-shaped noto- and neuropodial lobes, aciculae absent
chaetal lobes elongate ending in rounded lappet distally
neuropodia with sclerotinised ridges on distal edge
characters.name: diagnostic parapodial features:

states: compound spinigers with distally inflated shafts
dense fields of very small hooks in neuropodia
stout dark spines on segments 2 or 3
paleae present, arranged in fans across dorsum
neuroaciculae with elongated, axehead-shaped distal structure
limbate chaetae accompanying uncini in abdominal neuropodia
characters.name: diagnostic chaetae and aciculae features:

states: pygidium deeply cleft forming two large "feet"
tail end with flattened foliaceous scaphe
posterior end ventrally covered by sclerotised shield
one pair of pygidial cirri plus a single medial cirrus
characters.name: diagnostic features of the posterior end and pygidium:

states: cone-shaped, close-fitting and composed of sand grains
characters.name: diagnostic tube features:
<similar taxa>
data: <Flabelligeridae (share similar epidermal papillae and compound chaetae)>
<Ampharetidae, Terebellidae (share presence of multiple feeding palps located on dorsal fold within buccal cavity)>
<Alvinellidae (share presence of multiple feeding palps located on dorsal fold within buccal cavity)>
<Euphrosinidae (share presence of ciliated bands on caruncle)>
<Acoetidae (share presence of notopodial silk chaetae). Also other scaleworms Polynoidae and Eulepethidae (all have dorsal cirri modified as elytrae)>
<Spionidae (also may have very stout spines on an anterior segment)>
<Amphinomidae (share presence of ciliated bands on caruncle)>
